dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, uh, big news breaking, especially as the Republican National Convention really kicks off this week. New York's Attorney General, Letitia James, has just filed a pretty significant complaint against the Trump Organization.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, uh, big news breaking, especially as the Republican National Convention really kicks off this week. New York's Attorney General, Letitia James, has just filed a pretty significant complaint against the Trump Organization.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: And it comes as the Republican National Convention kicks off, when President Trump must make his case for reelection in November. According to the 68-page filing, James is investigating whether the Trump Organization misled investors by inflating the value of its assets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's, like, a 68-page filing, and it's alleging that the Trump Organization may have, you know, misled investors by inflating the value of its assets. Which, uh, that's a pretty serious charge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's, like, a sixty eight-page filing, and it's alleging that the Trump Organization may have, you know, misled investors by inflating the value of its assets. Which, uh, that's a pretty serious charge.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: According to the 68-page filing, James is investigating whether the Trump Organization misled investors by inflating the value of its assets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? And it's not just about the alleged inflation. James is also pushing for a judge to compel them to hand over financial info. And, uh, crucially, she wants Eric Trump to sit for an interview.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? And it's not just about the alleged inflation. James is also pushing for a judge to compel them to hand over financial info. And, uh, crucially, she wants Eric Trump to sit for an interview.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: James is also seeking for a judge to compel the Trump Organization to comply with subpoenas for its financial information, and to force Eric Trump, the companys executive vice president, to sit for an interview.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Which, um, he was supposed to, right? Like, back in July. But he backed out, claiming, you know, "constitutional rights." So now, the AG is really trying to force the issue.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, um, he was supposed to, right? Like, back in July. But he backed out, claiming, you know, constitutional rights. So now, the A G is really trying to force the issue.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Eric Trump, the complaint says, was scheduled to sit for an interview on July 22. He backed out two days prior, and the Trump Organization has since said he will not sit for an interview because of those rights afforded to every individual under the Constitution.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And the investigation, it's pretty wide-ranging. It covers properties like Seven Springs upstate, which is, uh, pretty significant, and then also 40 Wall Street, Trump Tower Chicago...
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And the investigation, it's pretty wide-ranging. It covers properties like Seven Springs upstate, which is, uh, pretty significant, and then also forty Wall Street, Trump Tower Chicago...
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The investigation also covers an upstate New York estate called Seven Springs, which the attorney general calls significant, along with 40 Wall Street in Manhattan, Trump Tower Chicago and Trumps Los Angeles golf club.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and that Seven Springs estate is a real focus, because it was, like, valued super high in statements to financial institutions. And, um, they apparently used its valuation to claim a massive $21.1 million tax deduction.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and that Seven Springs estate is a real focus, because it was, like, valued super high in statements to financial institutions. And, um, they apparently used its valuation to claim a massive twenty one point one million dollar tax deduction.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The valuation of the Seven Springs estate is one particular focus of the investigation because Trump included it as part of his net worth in statements to financial institutions, the complaint says. Seven Springs valuation was also used to claim a $21.1 million tax deduction 2015 after the Trump Organization donated part of its 212 acres for conservation efforts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Whoa. That's a huge number. So, this all started, like, way back in 2019, right? With Michael Cohen's testimony?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Whoa. That's a huge number. So, this all started, like, way back in twenty nineteen, right? With Michael Cohen's testimony?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The investigation began in February 2019 after Trumps former personal attorney and fixer, Michael Cohen, told Congress about the inflationary tactic Trump used for his assets, according to the Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I mean, that's what sparked it. Cohen told Congress about these, uh, "inflationary tactics" Trump allegedly used for his assets. And James is just like, "Nothing will stop us from following the facts and the law."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I mean, that's what sparked it. Cohen told Congress about these, uh, inflationary tactics Trump allegedly used for his assets. And James is just like, Nothing will stop us from following the facts and the law.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: CRUCIAL QUOTE Nothing will stop us from following the facts and the law, wherever they may lead.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Which is, you know, a very strong statement. And they're seeking thousands of documents and testimony from multiple witnesses.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which is, you know, a very strong statement. And they're seeking thousands of documents and testimony from multiple witnesses.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We are seeking thousands of documents and testimony from multiple witnesses regarding several Trump Organization properties and transactions, including from Eric Trump, who was intimately involved in one or more transactions under review, James wrote on Twitter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And Trump himself, uh, he spoke at the RNC yesterday, but hasn't commented on this filing yet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And Trump himself, uh, he spoke at the R N C yesterday, but hasn't commented on this filing yet.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Before James filed her complaint, President Trump spoke at the RNC Monday morning after being renominated for the Oval Office and has not yet commented on the filing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, no direct response. I mean, it's definitely going to be, uh, interesting to see how this plays out, especially with the election coming up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no direct response. I mean, it's definitely going to be, uh, interesting to see how this plays out, especially with the election coming up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. It just adds another layer to, you know, everything going on politically right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. It just adds another layer to, you know, everything going on politically right now.
